content.text:
Please analyze this codebase and create a CLAUDE.md file, which will be given to future instances of Claude Code to operate in this repository.

What to add:
1. Commands that will be commonly used, such as how to build, lint, and run tests. Include the necessary commands to develop in this codebase, such as how to run a single test.
2. High-level code architecture and structure so that future instances can be productive more quickly. Focus on the "big picture" architecture that requires reading multiple files to understand.

Usage notes:
- If there's already a CLAUDE.md, suggest improvements to it.
- When you make the initial CLAUDE.md, do not repeat yourself and do not include obvious instructions like "Provide helpful error messages to users", "Write unit tests for all new utilities", "Never include sensitive information (API keys, tokens) in code or commits".
- Avoid listing every component or file structure that can be easily discovered.
- Don't include generic development practices.
- If there are Cursor rules (in .cursor/rules/ or .cursorrules) or Copilot rules (in .github/copilot-instructions.md), make sure to include the important parts.
- If there is a README.md, make sure to include the important parts.
- Do not make up information such as "Common Development Tasks", "Tips for Development", "Support and Documentation" unless this is expressly included in other files that you read.
- Be sure to prefix the file with the following text:

```
# CLAUDE.md

This file provides guidance to Claude Code (claude.ai/code) when working with code in this repository.
```

1â†’version: "3"
     2â†’
     3â†’silent: true
     4â†’
     5â†’tasks:
     6â†’  default:
     7â†’    aliases:
     8â†’      - list
     9â†’    desc: List all tasks
    10â†’    cmd: task -l
    11â†’
    12â†’  setup-all:
    13â†’    desc: "Setup all"
    14â†’    cmds:
    15â†’      - task: init
    16â†’      - task: brew
    17â†’      - task: brew-mas
    18â†’      - task: link
    19â†’      - task: gui
    20â†’      - task: git
    21â†’      - task: other
    22â†’
    23â†’  init:
    24â†’    desc: "Install Rosetta-2 and Homebrew"
    25â†’    cmd: sh ./init.sh
    26â†’
    27â†’  brew:
    28â†’    desc: "Installing apps and command line tools with Homebrew"
    29â†’    cmds:
    30â†’      - brew bundle --file=brewfiles/Brewfile
    31â†’      # æ•°å°‘ãªã„Intel CPUã§ã‚¤ãƒ³ã‚¹ãƒˆãƒ¼ãƒ«ä¸å¯èƒ½ãªappã®ãŸã‚ã€ä¾‹å¤–çš„ã«ãƒ™ã‚¿æ›¸ã
    32â†’      - if [[ $(uname -m) == "arm64" ]]; then brew install --cask chatgpt; fi
    33â†’
    34â†’  brew-mas:
    35â†’    desc: "Installing Mac App Store apps with Homebrew"
    36â†’    cmd: brew bundle --file=brewfiles/Brewfile.mas
    37â†’
    38â†’  link:
    39â†’    desc: "Creating symlinks of dotfiles"
    40â†’    cmd: sh ./link.sh
    41â†’
    42â†’  gui:
    43â†’    desc: "Configuring MacOS GUI"
    44â†’    cmd: sh ./gui.sh
    45â†’
    46â†’  git:
    47â†’    desc: "Configuring GitHub"
    48â†’    cmd: sh ./github.sh
    49â†’
    50â†’  other:

    52â†’    cmd: sh ./other.sh

    15â†’    # ãƒãƒƒã‚¯ã‚¢ãƒƒãƒ—åã«ã¯æœ¬æ—¥ã®æ—¥ä»˜ã‚’å«ã‚ã¦ä½œæˆã™ã‚‹
    16â†’    today=$(date '+%Y%m%d')
    17â†’    backup="${dst_path}_${today}"
    18â†’    mv "$dst_path" "$backup"
    19â†’    echo "ğŸšš $name was backed up to $backup"
    20â†’  fi
    21â†’
    22â†’  # ã‚·ãƒ³ãƒœãƒªãƒƒã‚¯ãƒªãƒ³ã‚¯ã‚’ä½œæˆã™ã‚‹
    23â†’  ln -s "$src_path" "$dst_path"
    24â†’  echo "ğŸ‰ Created symbolic link to $name"
    25â†’}
    26â†’
    27â†’# ã‚«ãƒ¬ãƒ³ãƒˆãƒ‡ã‚£ãƒ¬ã‚¯ãƒˆãƒªã®å–å¾—
    28â†’HERE=$(pwd)
    29â†’
    30â†’# ~/ ç›´ä¸‹ã«ç½®ã .xxx ç³»ã®ãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«ç¾¤
    31â†’FILES=(.zshrc)
    32â†’for dotfile in "${FILES[@]}"; do
    33â†’  SRC_PATH="$HERE/$dotfile"
    34â†’  DST_PATH="$HOME/$dotfile"
    35â†’  backup_and_link "$SRC_PATH" "$DST_PATH" "$dotfile"
    36â†’done
    37â†’
    38â†’# ~/.config ç›´ä¸‹ã«ç½®ãè¨­å®šãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«ãƒ»ãƒ‡ã‚£ãƒ¬ã‚¯ãƒˆãƒªç¾¤
    39â†’CFGDIR="$HOME/.config"
    40â†’if [ ! -d "$CFGDIR" ]; then
    41â†’  mkdir -p "$CFGDIR"
    42â†’fi
    43â†’CONFIGS=(bat git karabiner)
    44â†’for cfg in "${CONFIGS[@]}"; do
    45â†’  SRC_PATH="$HERE/$cfg"
    46â†’  DST_PATH="$CFGDIR/$cfg"
    47â†’  backup_and_link "$SRC_PATH" "$DST_PATH" "$cfg"
    48â†’done
    49â†’
    50â†’# Claude Code ã®ã‚°ãƒ­ãƒ¼ãƒãƒ«ãªè¨­å®š
    51â†’SRC_PATH="$HERE/claude_global/settings.json"
    52â†’DST_PATH="$HOME/.claude/settings.json"
    53â†’backup_and_link "$SRC_PATH" "$DST_PATH" .claude/settings.json
    54â†’
    55â†’

1â†’name: Installation test on macOS
     2â†’
     3â†’on:
     4â†’  pull_request:
     5â†’    paths:
     6â†’      - .github/workflows/actions.yml
     7â†’      - brewfiles/Brewfile
     8â†’      - init.sh
     9â†’      - link.sh
    10â†’      - other.sh
    11â†’      - Taskfile.yml
    12â†’
    13â†’jobs:
    14â†’  setup:
    15â†’    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    16â†’    timeout-minutes: 5
    17â†’    outputs:
    18â†’      changed_files: ${{ steps.set-changed-files.outputs.changed_files }}
    19â†’
    20â†’    steps:
    21â†’      - name: Checkout repository
    22â†’        uses: actions/checkout@v4
    23â†’
    24â†’      # https://github.com/tj-actions/changed-files
    25â†’      - name: Get changed files
    26â†’        id: changed-files
    27â†’        uses: tj-actions/changed-files@v45
    28â†’        # To compare changes between the current commit and the last pushed remote commit set `since_last_remote_commit: true`. e.g
    29â†’        # with:
    30â†’        #   since_last_remote_commit: true
    31â†’
    32â†’      - name: Set changed files
    33â†’        id: set-changed-files
    34â†’        run: |
    35â†’          echo "changed_files=${{ steps.changed-files.outputs.all_changed_files }}" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
    36â†’
    37â†’  run:
    38â†’    runs-on: macos-latest
    39â†’    needs: setup
    40â†’    timeout-minutes: 20
    41â†’    steps:
    42â†’      - name: Checkout repository
    43â†’        uses: actions/checkout@v4
    44â†’
    45â†’      # https://github.com/arduino/setup-task
    46â†’      - name: Install Task (go-task)
    47â†’        uses: arduino/setup-task@v2
    48â†’        with:
    49â†’          version: 3.x
    50â†’          repo-token: ${{ secrets.ACCESS_TOKEN }}
    51â†’
    52â†’      - name: Initialization test
    53â†’        if: contains(needs.setup.outputs.changed_files, '.github/workflows/actions.yml') || contains(needs.setup.outputs.changed_files, 'Taskfile.yml') || contains(needs.setup.outputs.changed_files, 'init.sh') || contains(needs.setup.outputs.changed_files, 'brewfiles/Brewfile') || contains(needs.setup.outputs.changed_files, 'other.sh')
    54â†’        run: task init
    55â†’
    56â†’      - name: Symlink test
    57â†’        if: contains(needs.setup.outputs.changed_files, '.github/workflows/actions.yml') || contains(needs.setup.outputs.changed_files, 'Taskfile.yml') || contains(needs.setup.outputs.changed_files, 'link.sh')
    58â†’        run: |
    59â†’          task link
    60â†’          ls -al $HOME/.config
    61â†’
    62â†’      - name: Homrbrew test (without mas)
    63â†’        if: contains(needs.setup.outputs.changed_files, '.github/workflows/actions.yml') || contains(needs.setup.outputs.changed_files, 'Taskfile.yml') || contains(needs.setup.outputs.changed_files, 'brewfiles/Brewfile') || contains(needs.setup.outputs.changed_files, 'other.sh')
    64â†’        run: task brew
    65â†’
    66â†’      - name: Other test
    67â†’        if: contains(needs.setup.outputs.changed_files, '.github/workflows/actions.yml') || contains(needs.setup.outputs.changed_files, 'Taskfile.yml') || contains(needs.setup.outputs.changed_files, 'other.sh')
    68â†’        run: task other
    69â†’

Excellent! Now I have a comprehensive understanding. Let me create a detailed report:

---

## CLAUDE.md Repository Documentation

Based on my thorough exploration of the `/Users/snhryt/workspace/dotfiles` repository, here is a comprehensive analysis:

### 1. Overall Directory Structure & Purpose

This is a **macOS dotfiles management repository** for automated setup of a new Mac environment. It uses **task automation** (go-task) and **symlinks** (not stow) to manage configuration files. The repository is Japanese-first, with all documentation and comments in Japanese.

**Key Statistics:**
- 18 directories, 28 files
- Language: Primarily Zsh shell scripts with YAML (Taskfile)
- Owner: snhryt-neo (snhryt)
- License: MIT
- Architecture: Supports both ARM64 (Apple Silicon) and Intel Mac (Rosetta 2)

### 2. Tools & Configuration Managed

The dotfiles manage configurations for:
- **Shell**: Zsh + zplug plugins
- **Version Managers**: mise (Python, Node.js, Ruby, Go, etc.)
- **Package Manager**: Homebrew + Mac App Store (mas)
- **Git**: Global config, templates, git-secrets
- **Keyboard**: Karabiner-Elements keybindings
- **Editors**: Bat (cat replacement), Vim, Neovim, VS Code, Cursor
- **CLI Tools**: Modern command replacements (lsd, fd, rg, procs, bottom, duf, dust, trash-cli, zoxide, etc.)
- **Cloud CLIs**: Google Cloud SDK, AWS CLI
- **AI Tools**: Claude Desktop, Claude Code, ChatGPT, Codex
- **Other**: Raycast, Obsidian, Spotify, Docker/Rancher, etc.

### 3. Repository Structure & Organization

```
dotfiles/
â”œâ”€â”€ .claude/settings.json              # Claude Code global settings (symlinked to ~/.claude/)
â”œâ”€â”€ .codex/instructions.md             # Cursor/Codex AI instructions (not in link.sh)
â”œâ”€â”€ .entire/                           # Entire CLI cache directory
â”œâ”€â”€ .github/workflows/actions.yml      # GitHub Actions CI/CD for install tests
â”œâ”€â”€ bat/config                         # Bat (cat replacement) config â†’ ~/.config/bat/
â”œâ”€â”€ brewfiles/
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ Brewfile                       # Homebrew packages & casks
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ Brewfile.mas                   # Mac App Store apps
â”œâ”€â”€ claude_global/settings.json        # Claude Code settings to symlink
â”œâ”€â”€ git/
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ config                         # Git global config (user, aliases, secrets)
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ ignore                         # macOS global gitignore
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ templates/
â”‚       â”œâ”€â”€ commit-message             # Emoji prefix & conventional commits reference
â”‚       â””â”€â”€ secrets/hooks/             # git-secrets hooks
â”œâ”€â”€ karabiner/
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ karabiner.json                 # Main keybinding config
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ assets/complex_modifications/  # Additional keyboard layouts
â”œâ”€â”€ snapshots/                         # Manual install snapshots (Chrome extensions, etc.)
â”œâ”€â”€ .zshrc                             # Main zsh configuration
â”œâ”€â”€ .pre-commit-config.yaml            # Pre-commit hooks config
â”œâ”€â”€ Taskfile.yml                       # go-task orchestration
â”œâ”€â”€ init.sh                            # Installs Rosetta 2 & Homebrew
â”œâ”€â”€ link.sh                            # Creates symlinks (idempotent)
â”œâ”€â”€ github.sh                          # GitHub/SSH setup & authentication
â”œâ”€â”€ gui.sh                             # macOS defaults configuration
â”œâ”€â”€ other.sh                           # Additional tools (zplug, mise, npm packages)
â”œâ”€â”€ README.md                          # Documentation in Japanese
â””â”€â”€ LICENSE                            # MIT license
```

### 4. Symlink Strategy & Linking Convention

**Method**: Manual symlinks using `link.sh` (NOT stow)

**Linking Convention:**
```zsh
# Files in root â†’ ~/
.zshrc â†’ ~/.zshrc

# Directories â†’ ~/.config/
bat/     â†’ ~/.config/bat/
git/     â†’ ~/.config/git/
karabiner/ â†’ ~/.config/karabiner/

# Claude Code settings

version: "3"

silent: true

tasks:
  default:
    aliases:
      - list
    desc: List all tasks
    cmd: task -l

  setup-all:
    desc: "Setup all"
    cmds:
      - task: init
      - task: brew
      - task: brew-mas
      - task: link
      - task: gui
      - task: git
      - task: other

  init:
    desc: "Install Rosetta-2 and Homebrew"
    cmd: sh ./init.sh

  brew:
    desc: "Installing apps and command line tools with Homebrew"
    cmds:
      - brew bundle --file=brewfiles/Brewfile
      # æ•°å°‘ãªã„Intel CPUã§ã‚¤ãƒ³ã‚¹ãƒˆãƒ¼ãƒ«ä¸å¯èƒ½ãªappã®ãŸã‚ã€ä¾‹å¤–çš„ã«ãƒ™ã‚¿æ›¸ã
      - if [[ $(uname -m) == "arm64" ]]; then brew install --cask chatgpt; fi

  brew-mas:

    cmd: sh ./gui.sh

  git:
    desc: "Configuring GitHub"
    cmd: sh ./github.sh

  other:
    desc: "Configuring others"
    cmd: sh ./other.sh

#!/bin/zsh
set -e

backup_and_link() {
  local src_path=$1
  local dst_path=$2
  local name=$3

  if [ -L "$dst_path" ]; then
    # ã™ã§ã«ã‚·ãƒ³ãƒœãƒªãƒƒã‚¯ãƒªãƒ³ã‚¯ãŒè²¼ã‚‰ã‚Œã¦ã„ã‚‹å ´åˆã¯ç„¡è¦–ã™ã‚‹
    echo "âš ï¸ $dst_path is already a symbolic link"
    return
  elif [ -e "$dst_path" ]; then
    # ãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«ã¾ãŸã¯ãƒ‡ã‚£ãƒ¬ã‚¯ãƒˆãƒªã®å®Ÿæ…‹å­˜åœ¨ã™ã‚‹å ´åˆã¯ãƒãƒƒã‚¯ã‚¢ãƒƒãƒ—ã‚’ä½œæˆã™ã‚‹
    # ãƒãƒƒã‚¯ã‚¢ãƒƒãƒ—åã«ã¯æœ¬æ—¥ã®æ—¥ä»˜ã‚’å«ã‚ã¦ä½œæˆã™ã‚‹
    today=$(date '+%Y%m%d')
    backup="${dst_path}_${today}"
    mv "$dst_path" "$backup"
    echo "ğŸšš $name was backed up to $backup"
  fi

  # ã‚·ãƒ³ãƒœãƒªãƒƒã‚¯ãƒªãƒ³ã‚¯ã‚’ä½œæˆã™ã‚‹
  ln -s "$src_path" "$dst_path"
  echo "ğŸ‰ Created symbolic link to $name"
}

# ã‚«ãƒ¬ãƒ³ãƒˆãƒ‡ã‚£ãƒ¬ã‚¯ãƒˆãƒªã®å–å¾—
HERE=$(pwd)

# ~/ ç›´ä¸‹ã«ç½®ã .xxx ç³»ã®ãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«ç¾¤
FILES=(.zshrc)
for dotfile in "${FILES[@]}"; do
  SRC_PATH="$HERE/$dotfile"
  DST_PATH="$HOME/$dotfile"
  backup_and_link "$SRC_PATH" "$DST_PATH" "$dotfile"
done

# ~/.config ç›´ä¸‹ã«ç½®ãè¨­å®šãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«ãƒ»ãƒ‡ã‚£ãƒ¬ã‚¯ãƒˆãƒªç¾¤
CFGDIR="$HOME/.config"
if [ ! -d "$CFGDIR" ]; then
  mkdir -p "$CFGDIR"
fi
CONFIGS=(bat git karabiner)
for cfg in "${CONFIGS[@]}"; do
  SRC_PATH="$HERE/$cfg"
  DST_PATH="$CFGDIR/$cfg"
  backup_and_link "$SRC_PATH" "$DST_PATH" "$cfg"
done

# Claude Code ã®ã‚°ãƒ­ãƒ¼ãƒãƒ«ãªè¨­å®š
SRC_PATH="$HERE/claude_global/settings.json"
DST_PATH="$HOME/.claude/settings.json"
backup_and_link "$SRC_PATH" "$DST_PATH" .claude/settings.json

# CLAUDE.md

This file provides guidance to Claude Code (claude.ai/code) when working with code in this repository.

## Overview

macOS dotfiles repository for automated setup of a new Mac environment. Uses go-task for orchestration and manual symlinks (not stow) for dotfile management. Supports both ARM64 (Apple Silicon) and Intel Mac.

## Language

æ—¥æœ¬èªã§ã‚„ã‚Šã¨ã‚Šã‚’ã™ã‚‹ã€‚ã‚³ãƒ¼ãƒ‰å†…ã®ã‚³ãƒ¡ãƒ³ãƒˆã‚‚æ—¥æœ¬èªã§æ›¸ãã€‚çµµæ–‡å­—åˆ©ç”¨OKã€‚

## Commands

### Setup (via go-task)

```bash
task setup-all    # Full setup (runs all tasks below in order)
task init         # Install Rosetta 2 + Homebrew
task brew         # Install CLI tools & casks from brewfiles/Brewfile
task brew-mas     # Install Mac App Store apps from brewfiles/Brewfile.mas
task link         # Create symlinks for dotfiles
task gui          # Apply macOS GUI defaults
task git          # Setup GitHub/SSH authentication
task other        # Install zplug, mise, npm packages
```

### Linting / Formatting

```bash
pre-commit run --all-files    # Run all pre-commit hooks
shellcheck -x <script>.sh     # Shell script static analysis
shfmt -i 2 -ci <script>.sh   # Shell script formatting (2-space indent, case indent)
```

## Architecture

### Symlink Strategy

`link.sh` creates symlinks with idempotency (skips existing links, backs up existing files with date suffix):

- Root dotfiles (`FILES` array) â†’ `~/` (e.g., `.zshrc` â†’ `~/.zshrc`)
- Config directories (`CONFIGS` array) â†’ `~/.config/` (e.g., `git/` â†’ `~/.config/git/`)
- Special: `claude_global/settings.json` â†’ `~/.claude/settings.json`

### Task Orchestration

`Taskfile.yml` defines the setup pipeline. Each task maps to a shell script (`init.sh`, `link.sh`, `github.sh`, `gui.sh`, `other.sh`) or direct brew commands. Tasks run sequentially via `setup-all`.

### Shell Script Conventions

- Shebang: `#!/bin/zsh`
- `set -e` for fail-fast
- Idempotent: check if tool/link exists before acting
- Comments in Japanese with emoji indicators

### Commit Message Convention

Emoji prefix + Conventional Commits (see `git/templates/commit-message`):
- âœ¨ `feat:` æ–°æ©Ÿèƒ½ / ğŸ› `fix:` ãƒã‚°ä¿®æ­£ / âš¡ `perf:` ãƒ‘ãƒ•ã‚©ãƒ¼ãƒãƒ³ã‚¹å‘ä¸Š
- ğŸ“ `docs:` / ğŸš¨ `test:` / ğŸ‘· `ci:` / â™»ï¸ `refactor:` / ğŸ”§ `chore:` è¨­å®šå¤‰æ›´

### Homebrew Management

- `brewfiles/Brewfile` â€” CLI tools, casks, fonts (categorized with Japanese comments)
- `brewfiles/Brewfile.mas` â€” Mac App Store apps
- ARM64-specific installs handled in `Taskfile.yml` with `uname -m` check

### CI

GitHub Actions (`.github/workflows/actions.yml`) runs on PRs when setup-related files change. Tests `task init`, `task link`, `task brew`, `task other` on macOS runners.

# CLAUDE.md

This file provides guidance to Claude Code (claude.ai/code) when working with code in this repository.

## Overview

macOS dotfiles repository for automated setup of a new Mac environment. Uses go-task for orchestration and manual symlinks (not stow) for dotfile management. Supports both ARM64 (Apple Silicon) and Intel Mac.

## Language

æ—¥æœ¬èªã§ã‚„ã‚Šã¨ã‚Šã‚’ã™ã‚‹ã€‚ã‚³ãƒ¼ãƒ‰å†…ã®ã‚³ãƒ¡ãƒ³ãƒˆã‚‚æ—¥æœ¬èªã§æ›¸ãã€‚çµµæ–‡å­—åˆ©ç”¨OKã€‚

## Commands

### Setup (via go-task)

```bash
task setup-all    # Full setup (runs all tasks below in order)
task init         # Install Rosetta 2 + Homebrew
task brew         # Install CLI tools & casks from brewfiles/Brewfile
task brew-mas     # Install Mac App Store apps from brewfiles/Brewfile.mas
task link         # Create symlinks for dotfiles
task gui          # Apply macOS GUI defaults
task git          # Setup GitHub/SSH authentication
task other        # Install zplug, mise, npm packages
```

### Linting / Formatting

```bash
pre-commit run --all-files    # Run all pre-commit hooks
shellcheck -x <script>.sh     # Shell script static analysis
shfmt -i 2 -ci <script>.sh   # Shell script formatting (2-space indent, case indent)
```

## Architecture

### Symlink Strategy

`link.sh` creates symlinks with idempotency (skips existing links, backs up existing files with date suffix):

- Root dotfiles (`FILES` array) â†’ `~/` (e.g., `.zshrc` â†’ `~/.zshrc`)
- Config directories (`CONFIGS` array) â†’ `~/.config/` (e.g., `git/` â†’ `~/.config/git/`)
- Special: `claude_global/settings.json` â†’ `~/.claude/settings.json`

### Task Orchestration

`Taskfile.yml` defines the setup pipeline. Each task maps to a shell script (`init.sh`, `link.sh`, `github.sh`, `gui.sh`, `other.sh`) or direct brew commands. Tasks run sequentially via `setup-all`.

### Shell Script Conventions

- Shebang: `#!/bin/zsh`
- `set -e` for fail-fast
- Idempotent: check if tool/link exists before acting
- Comments in Japanese with emoji indicators

### Commit Message Convention

Emoji prefix + Conventional Commits (see `git/templates/commit-message`):
- âœ¨ `feat:` æ–°æ©Ÿèƒ½ / ğŸ› `fix:` ãƒã‚°ä¿®æ­£ / âš¡ `perf:` ãƒ‘ãƒ•ã‚©ãƒ¼ãƒãƒ³ã‚¹å‘ä¸Š
- ğŸ“ `docs:` / ğŸš¨ `test:` / ğŸ‘· `ci:` / â™»ï¸ `refactor:` / ğŸ”§ `chore:` è¨­å®šå¤‰æ›´

### Homebrew Management

- `brewfiles/Brewfile` â€” CLI tools, casks, fonts (categorized with Japanese comments)
- `brewfiles/Brewfile.mas` â€” Mac App Store apps
- ARM64-specific installs handled in `Taskfile.yml` with `uname -m` check

### CI

GitHub Actions (`.github/workflows/actions.yml`) runs on PRs when setup-related files change. Tests `task init`, `task link`, `task brew`, `task other` on macOS runners.

#!/bin/zsh
set -e

backup_and_link() {
  local src_path=$1
  local dst_path=$2
  local name=$3

  if [ -L "$dst_path" ]; then
    # ã™ã§ã«ã‚·ãƒ³ãƒœãƒªãƒƒã‚¯ãƒªãƒ³ã‚¯ãŒè²¼ã‚‰ã‚Œã¦ã„ã‚‹å ´åˆã¯ç„¡è¦–ã™ã‚‹
    echo "âš ï¸ $dst_path is already a symbolic link"
    return
  elif [ -e "$dst_path" ]; then
    # ãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«ã¾ãŸã¯ãƒ‡ã‚£ãƒ¬ã‚¯ãƒˆãƒªã®å®Ÿæ…‹å­˜åœ¨ã™ã‚‹å ´åˆã¯ãƒãƒƒã‚¯ã‚¢ãƒƒãƒ—ã‚’ä½œæˆã™ã‚‹
    # ãƒãƒƒã‚¯ã‚¢ãƒƒãƒ—åã«ã¯æœ¬æ—¥ã®æ—¥ä»˜ã‚’å«ã‚ã¦ä½œæˆã™ã‚‹
    today=$(date '+%Y%m%d')
    backup="${dst_path}_${today}"
    mv "$dst_path" "$backup"
    echo "ğŸšš $name was backed up to $backup"
  fi

  # ã‚·ãƒ³ãƒœãƒªãƒƒã‚¯ãƒªãƒ³ã‚¯ã‚’ä½œæˆã™ã‚‹
  ln -s "$src_path" "$dst_path"
  echo "ğŸ‰ Created symbolic link to $name"
}

# ã‚«ãƒ¬ãƒ³ãƒˆãƒ‡ã‚£ãƒ¬ã‚¯ãƒˆãƒªã®å–å¾—
HERE=$(pwd)

# ~/ ç›´ä¸‹ã«ç½®ã .xxx ç³»ã®ãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«ç¾¤
FILES=(.zshrc)
for dotfile in "${FILES[@]}"; do
  SRC_PATH="$HERE/$dotfile"
  DST_PATH="$HOME/$dotfile"
  backup_and_link "$SRC_PATH" "$DST_PATH" "$dotfile"
done

# ~/.config ç›´ä¸‹ã«ç½®ãè¨­å®šãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«ãƒ»ãƒ‡ã‚£ãƒ¬ã‚¯ãƒˆãƒªç¾¤
CFGDIR="$HOME/.config"
if [ ! -d "$CFGDIR" ]; then
  mkdir -p "$CFGDIR"
fi
CONFIGS=(bat git karabiner)
for cfg in "${CONFIGS[@]}"; do
  SRC_PATH="$HERE/$cfg"
  DST_PATH="$CFGDIR/$cfg"
  backup_and_link "$SRC_PATH" "$DST_PATH" "$cfg"
done

#!/bin/zsh
set -e

backup_and_link() {
  local src_path=$1
  local dst_path=$2
  local name=$3

  if [ -L "$dst_path" ]; then
    # ã™ã§ã«ã‚·ãƒ³ãƒœãƒªãƒƒã‚¯ãƒªãƒ³ã‚¯ãŒè²¼ã‚‰ã‚Œã¦ã„ã‚‹å ´åˆã¯ç„¡è¦–ã™ã‚‹
    echo "âš ï¸ $dst_path is already a symbolic link"
    return
  elif [ -e "$dst_path" ]; then
    # ãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«ã¾ãŸã¯ãƒ‡ã‚£ãƒ¬ã‚¯ãƒˆãƒªã®å®Ÿæ…‹å­˜åœ¨ã™ã‚‹å ´åˆã¯ãƒãƒƒã‚¯ã‚¢ãƒƒãƒ—ã‚’ä½œæˆã™ã‚‹
    # ãƒãƒƒã‚¯ã‚¢ãƒƒãƒ—åã«ã¯æœ¬æ—¥ã®æ—¥ä»˜ã‚’å«ã‚ã¦ä½œæˆã™ã‚‹
    today=$(date '+%Y%m%d')
    backup="${dst_path}_${today}"
    mv "$dst_path" "$backup"
    echo "ğŸšš $name was backed up to $backup"
  fi

  # ã‚·ãƒ³ãƒœãƒªãƒƒã‚¯ãƒªãƒ³ã‚¯ã‚’ä½œæˆã™ã‚‹
  ln -s "$src_path" "$dst_path"
  echo "ğŸ‰ Created symbolic link to $name"
}

# ã‚«ãƒ¬ãƒ³ãƒˆãƒ‡ã‚£ãƒ¬ã‚¯ãƒˆãƒªã®å–å¾—
HERE=$(pwd)

# ~/ ç›´ä¸‹ã«ç½®ã .xxx ç³»ã®ãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«ç¾¤
FILES=(.zshrc)
for dotfile in "${FILES[@]}"; do
  SRC_PATH="$HERE/$dotfile"
  DST_PATH="$HOME/$dotfile"
  backup_and_link "$SRC_PATH" "$DST_PATH" "$dotfile"
done

# ~/.config ç›´ä¸‹ã«ç½®ãè¨­å®šãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«ãƒ»ãƒ‡ã‚£ãƒ¬ã‚¯ãƒˆãƒªç¾¤
CFGDIR="$HOME/.config"
if [ ! -d "$CFGDIR" ]; then
  mkdir -p "$CFGDIR"
fi
CONFIGS=(bat git karabiner)
for cfg in "${CONFIGS[@]}"; do
  SRC_PATH="$HERE/$cfg"
  DST_PATH="$CFGDIR/$cfg"
  backup_and_link "$SRC_PATH" "$DST_PATH" "$cfg"
done

# Claude Code ã®ã‚°ãƒ­ãƒ¼ãƒãƒ«ãªè¨­å®š
SRC_PATH="$HERE/claude_global/settings.json"
DST_PATH="$HOME/.claude/settings.json"
backup_and_link "$SRC_PATH" "$DST_PATH" .claude/settings.json
